info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hampshire, central Franklin and central Hampden Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Hadley, or near Holyoke, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Heavy rain and brief poor drainage street flooding are also possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Chicopee, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Ludlow, South Hadley, Easthampton, East Longmeadow, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Palmer, Monson, Granby, Southampton, Hadley, Hampden, Hatfield, Williamsburg and Conway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
